query: King of the Lake gravel race Lake Constance

videos.title: Bikepacking around Lake Constance (Bodensee)
videos.description:
The bike route around Lake Constance (Bodensee in German) offers easy and relaxed cycling on good bike lanes and smaller roads in Central Europe. There are plenty of sights, beaches, restaurants, cafes and accommodation along the route. You can also rent bikes at many places, which makes this rout into a great starting point for any sort of bike touring. 
You can easily make excursions, on gravel paths as well as by train to nearby sights. The video takes you on a tour around the lake including excursions, and finally connects to another route, the initial part of the Danube bike route: https://youtu.be/EFBvbGBN8pQ 

For timestamps, follow these links:
0:00 Intro
0:25 Route map
0:41 Friederichshafen
0:58 Lindau
1:11 Bregenz
1:24 Rhine Delta
1:57 St. Gallen
2:30 Constance
3:20 Stein am Rhein
4:00 Radolfzell 

Other bike touring videos
Danube bike route, from Donaueschingen to Passau: https://youtu.be/EFBvbGBN8pQ
Innsbruck to Vienna via Passau: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ECUYtNW3Qt8&t=135s
Innsbruck to Venice: https://youtu.be/OJMjRyIfi28
Gothenburg to Stockholm: https://youtu.be/bUR8Ca5J4U0

Navigation
Open cycle map: https://www.opencyclemap.org/ 
Bike touring guidebooks: https://www.esterbauer.com/

Video stuff
Cameras: Insta360 One X2 and Sony RX100
Microphone: Røde Wireless Go II
Handlebar camera mount VC-100: http://www.minoura.jp/english/accessory/accessory.html


#cycling #roadbike #bikeride #cyclingaustria #cyclinggermany #cyclingswitzerland #cycletouring

videos.title: 4x4 Extreme hill climbing in Formula Offroad @ Skien 2019
videos.description:
Extreme hill climbing in Formula Offroad with little, lite and powerful 4x4 custom built vehicles, lets see what this extreme machinery is capable of in action and take a look on what these little monster vehicles are capable of doing in hilly terrain layout in "KNA Telemark Offroad" an Formula Offroad competition event at Skien, Norway 2019

Like Our videos!    Support our channel with your views and subscribe.

About us:
We're K4 Movies a YouTube channel, that films Off-Road Trucks, Truck trials, Off-Road vehicles, Machinery and People, and other sport events and we're reflecting them in our channel for people to see it all around the world.

Hashtags:
#K4Movies #OffRoad #TruckTrial #Vehicle #Machinery #FormulaOffroad

videos.title: The 5 Most Unfriendly Countries I Have Ever Visited
videos.description:
We have been traveling the world for a few decades now and having been to dozens of countries, hunderds of cities around the world we have had some great experiences meeting locals, and some not so great experiences. So here are the five more unfriendly places we have been to. 
Filmed in Friendly Turku, Finland

➤ Book your accommodation and experiences:
Aamuranta: https://booking.tpk.lv/FRgy51qz
Scandic Hamburger Börs: https://booking.tpk.lv/NwOUE2tU

Helsinki Airport Transfer Service: https://getyourguide.tpk.lv/7lseZGed
Best of Turku: Private Walking Tour with a Local: https://getyourguide.tpk.lv/aFZzDaRS

Join this channel to get access to perks:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFr3sz2t3bDp6Cux08B93KQ/join

Grab some Wolters World travel gear http://www.woltersworld.store

Help Us Keep Make More Honest Travel Videos: https://www.patreon.com/woltersworld

hey there fellow Travelers Mark here

and today we want to talk about our well
I'm going to answer one of your
questions that is Mark what are the most
unfriendly places you've visited well
there's been a few over the years I know
people like to make comments on our
videos say Mark you always say that
these people are friendly you say every
place got friendly people like yeah
every time you can find some friendly
people but overall if you watch my
videos you'll notice sometimes I don't
mention the people people at all
probably a good sign that the people
weren't that friendly and so what I have
here are just five countries where I
notice a little bit less friendliness
than usual when I traveled and some of
it was more of an issue some of it was
just the situations but these are five
places I had number one Belgium look you
all know I'm not the biggest fan of

of them sometimes but I can respect
Brussels for its museums and all the

have I've taken students there and I've
done things there I love get I love Bru
it's a fun time to go but overall the
belgians themselves not always the most
friendly people and if you are of
African descent or Asian descent that is
the one country I've gone to Europe with
my students where we had racist attacks
on my students okay like I literally had
to talk to the police we were l in
because my students were getting
harassed okay like that's one thing so
that's one place I didn't find super
friendly now I have friends from there
there was some there's nice people in
Belgium but I'm going saying overall
that was one place H was a little bit uh
touchy second place where the people w
weren't so friendly was we were in China
and what's funny when we were in China
and we'd have like one two or three
people around us every was super
friendly and kind and fun it was really
a great time but once we got a big group
of people then everybody started
fighting over seats in the restaurant or
or the dragon fruit at there grocery no
joke or when you're going into a place
of people whacking you with things like
it was just like not a very friendly
experience and I think part of it is
because there's just so many people that
it's a you know people are worried
they're not going to get stuff and
therefore I've got to get on this
elevator be damned everyone else so
that's one thing where I didn't really
have a very friendly experience when I
was there but it was a cool experience
but I mean I'd go back to all these
places I'm talking about but I'm just
saying you wanted to know now number
three is a very interesting one and that
is Denmark now the Danes you might say
they're rude I like to say they don't
care about you because you're not part
of their life they don't mean it in a
bad way okay they're not trying to be
mean they just like we're Danish we live
in Denmark uh you're a tourist is here
for a few days why do I care what you
think about my country I want to be here
anywhere I love Denmark so forget you
and so it's kind of the um kind of like
you're not part of my life so I don't
care kind of vibe you get uh when you go
to Denmark now the Danes can be fun
times to go out party with don't get me
wrong we've had some good times with
some Danish friends over the years but
but that kind
of distance they have makes it so it's a
little bit unfriendly okay not that
they're mean about it just like hey we
don't care I remember I was in
Copenhagen filming and I was talking
about that kind of thing that that Dan
are that's Danish guy came up he's like
thank you you explain it very well it's
not that I don't like you it's just that
I don't care and he walks off there you
go maybe they're not unfriendly they
just don't care which is fine okay you
have that now number four on our list is
Argentina but when I say Argentina I'm
more talking about inborn asares cuz
bisar if you meet people from there and
they talk about the rest of Argentina
you might hear this oh are you from La
capital or La Provincia so you're from
the capital or the provinces right and
so there is kind of a like an some
people was say attitude with people are
in Bor sometime and and I had a good
time when I lived there and I had a fun
time but I did know it was definitely a
different attitude in terms of
friendliness that you got outside of the
capital versus inside the capital so
that's another place where I didn't find
people be super friendly when I was
there and then we have number five which
would be number one if I was ranking in
the unfriendliness and that is Luxemburg
see you go to Luxemburg they get paid
really well they have a nice place they
live they have good stuff there they got
plenty of money they don't care about
you they don't care about Serv they
don't care about helping you they don't
care about anything cuz you don't matter
cuz they're fine you're coming to
Luxembourg so you should thank us that
we're letting you come here that's the
vibe you get sometimes at the
restaurants at the par the tourist stuff
it's a little frustrating and that's one
of those things where you're just like
oh why are you so unfriendly I mean it's
funny cuz I have friends that live there
and we enjoy visiting them but I would
say as a
tourist I that was a very friendly when
I was there and here's the thing I know
these are five places that I've been to
and I filmed that and I en enjoyed
myself there but I went through my list
of places where I found in general like
the most unfriendly to me and my family
those would be the five places so uh if
you're from those places I'm not trying
to insult you because I had a good time
there and you might be a friend of mine
from there but those are the five places
I've been they really found that people
weren't that super friendly but don't
worry there's plenty of friendly people
that actually are in those countries so
you can meet them but also we have a
list in a video on the most friendly
places we've been to and that V that

really think about like five where I
really thought people weren't that
friendly it was actually kind of tough
to come up with this one well not for
one of the places though or two actually
but anyway you get the idea what was the
most unfriendly place you've been to let
us know in the comments below and tell
us what happened to share your story
about why you thought it was so
unfriendly and I'll say bye from here in
Friendly Finland

videos.transcript:
what if I told you that what you read on
the Internet or maybe what you were
taught was totally wrong what if us as a
motorcycle Community have been looking
at corner entrants the wrong way let me
show you what I mean
[Music]
we are on the most epic Road in all of
America this is Beartooth pass Highway
212 from cook City in the north corner
of Yellowstone National Park to Red
Lodge Montana it reaches to 11 000 feet
in elevation it's not the most technical
or the most challenging but it is
absolutely spectacular
it is the perfect Road for what we're
going to be talking about today because
a mistake here can lead to dire
consequences I mean look at that don't
mess that up
now I think we can all agree that
rushing Corner entrance is bad we don't
want to go into any Corner faster than
we can see we've all been there we've
all overcooked the corner entrance and
we can all agree that it's not fun
before we get into what I really want to
say you can't make any kind of good
decision if you're looking at your front
wheel so first and foremost get those
eyes up focus on where you are and what
you're doing
so here we are at the entrance to one of
a one of a thousand blind corners on
this road if the prevailing thought is
that we need to be off the brakes before
tipping and then gently accelerate
throughout the entire corner or even
neutral throttle what is that entrance
speed if we're gonna say that we have to
be off the brakes at a certain point
that means that there's a definitive
answer you've never seen this corner
before you have no idea what's on the
other side of this corner it's been five
years since I've seen this corner I have
no idea what's on the other side of the
corner is the speed limit or those
Corner advisory speeds is that the
correct speed that as long as we stay
below that number everything is going to
be all right now imagine that it's
raining or it's a super cold morning and
there's Frost in all the Shadows where
your tires are worn out what is the
suitable entrance speed now so right now
we're just sitting here looking at this
corner we have a lot of time to kind of
process what we can see but when we're
actually riding we have to make this
decision rather quickly we only have a
few seconds to decide what that suitable
entrance speed is and making that
decision before we can see the exit of
the corner is like trying to predict the
future I'm not very good at predicting
the future if I was I probably wouldn't
have spent those 10 000 Bitcoins on
those two supreme pizzas watch what
happens to my suspension if I try to get
all my braking done before tipping you
see how the front just Springs back up
